com.simplify.payments.exception

Class ApiException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • com.simplify.payments.exception.ApiException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ApiCommunicationException, AuthenticationException, InvalidRequestException, NotAllowedException, ObjectNotFoundException, SystemException

    public class ApiException
extends java.lang.Exception
    Base class for all API exceptions.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ApiException()
      Constructs an ApiException with no detail message.
      ApiException(int status, java.util.Map<? extends java.lang.String,? extends java.lang.Object> errorData)
      Constructs an ApiException with the specified details status and error data.
      ApiException(java.lang.String s)
      Constructs an ApiException with the specified detail message.
      ApiException(java.lang.String s, java.lang.Throwable cause)
      Constructs an ApiException with the specified detail message and cause.
      ApiException(java.lang.Throwable cause)
      Constructs an ApiCommunicationException with the specified cause.

      • ApiException

        public ApiException(java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Constructs an ApiCommunicationException with the specified cause.
        Parameters:
        cause - the detail message.

      • ApiException

        public ApiException(int status,
            java.util.Map<? extends java.lang.String,? extends java.lang.Object> errorData)
        Constructs an ApiException with the specified details status and error data.
        Parameters:
        status - the HTTP status code
        errorData - a map representing the error details returned by the API. The map is expected to contain String value for the key "reference" and a map containing the detailed error data for the key "key". This map in turn is expected to contain String values for the keys "code" and "message".

    • Method Detail

      • getErrorData

        public java.util.Map<? extends java.lang.String,? extends java.lang.Object> getErrorData()
        Returns the API error data for this exception.
        Returns:
        a map representing the error data for this exception (which may be null).

      • getReference

        public java.lang.String getReference()
        Returns the reference string for this exception.
        Returns:
        an ID representing a unique reference for API error (which may be null).

      • getErrorCode

        public java.lang.String getErrorCode()
        Returns the error code for this exception.
        Returns:
        a string representing the API error code (which may be null).

      • getStatus

        public int getStatus()
        Returns the HTTP status code for this exception.
        Returns:
        an integer representing the HTTP status code for this API error (or 0 if there is no status)

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage()
        Returns the string detail message for this exception.
        Overrides:
        getMessage in class java.lang.Throwable
        Returns:
        a string representing the API error code or the message detail used to construct the exception (which may be null).

      • describe

        public java.lang.String describe()
        Returns a string describing the exception.
        Returns:
        a string describing the exception.
